intro: Goeppertia ackermannii, commonly known as the Ackermann's arrowroot, is a striking ornamental plant native to South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other tropical plants. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with shades of green, white, and silver. It produces striking orange-red inflorescences that resemble a torch, adding visual interest to any garden. Goeppertia ackermannii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil.
